recipie_ingredients: half cup of choppped white onion, 2 tablespoons of lime juice, 1 jalepeno, 2 avacados, salt and black pepper
recipie_instructions: STEP 1: combine opnion and lime juice in a small bowl STEP 2: Cut up jalepeno remove the inner seeds chop the jalepeno and add to bowl STEP 3: cut the avacados in half de pit them and scoop out the rest with a spoon, add to bowl then Mix STEP 5: Enjoy!

recipie_ingredients: 1 3/4 pounds of flank steak STEP 2: 6 6 telera rolls, split STEP 3: 1 1/2 cups refried black beans 2 ripe avocados
recipie_instructions: STEP 1 Lay steak on cutting board. Make three diagonal slashes in meat STEP2  Place steak on grill; cook 15 minutes, turning over after 8 minutes. Let rest 10 minutes before thinly slicing against the grain. STEP 3 Spread rolls with a layer of refried beans on one side of each roll and place a layer of sliced avocado on the other side  Divide sliced steak and suggested fillings evenly among rolls

recipie_ingredients: 1 and a half pounds of skirt steak sliced into small pieces, half teaspoon of salt, quarter teaspoon of pepper, 1 tablespoon of oil, half cup of heavy cream, 4 flour tortillas, 1 cup of shredded mexican style cheese blend 1 cup black beans rinsed and drained crema mexicana and chopped tomatoes and cilantro
recipie_instructions: STEP 1: Season steak with salt and pepper. STEP 2: in a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add steak and saut√© 3 to 5 minutes STEP3: In a small saucepan over medium heat combine guacamole salsa and heavy cream. STEP 4: simmer and keep warm STEP 5 plate and eat!

recipie_ingredients: 1 Organic White Pizza Dough, Pure Olive Oil, All Purpose Flour, Basting Oil, Pizza Sauce,  Shredded Whole Milk Mozzarella, Italian Classics Fresh Mozzarella, sliced Roasted Red Tomatoes, drained Basil leaves torn into smaller pieces
recipie_instructions: Divide dough into 2 equal pieces; form into balls. Coat 2 large bowls with 1/4 tsp olive oil; place 1 dough ball in each. Cover bowls with plastic wrap. Let dough come to room temp, 1-2 hours. 2. Preheat oven to 400 degrees with rack in center. Shape each dough ball on lightly floured surface into 14-inch rounds. Lightly coat two 14-inch pizza pans with 1/4 tsp olive oil. Form dough to fit pans, pressing out any air bubbles. 3. Brush each crust evenly with 1/2 Tbsp basting oil; spread with 1/3 cup of sauce and top with 1/3 cup shredded mozzarella. Break fresh mozzarella into smaller pieces; sprinkle evenly on crusts. Top each crust with 1/2 cup tomatoes. 4. Bake, 18-20 min. Remove from oven; let rest 5 min before slicing. Sprinkle with basil before serving.
